meanings.definition: To fit (an arrow) to a bowstring.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys nocking the arrow before taking aim.
meanings.sent2: The archer carefully practiced nocking the arrow on the bowstring.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy archer kept nocking the arrow backwards, causing laughter among the spectators.
meanings.sent4: His determination to hit the target was like nocking an arrow ready to strike.
meanings.sent5: With each smooth motion, she perfected the art of nocking the arrow effortlessly.

meanings.definition: The act of fitting an arrow to a bowstring.
meanings.sent1: The nocking of the arrow signaled the beginning of the archery competition.
meanings.sent2: His swift and precise nocking impressed the other archers.
meanings.sent3: The sound of nocking arrows filled the air with anticipation.
meanings.sent4: In the quiet forest, the nocking of arrows echoed like a melody.
meanings.sent5: The nocking of the arrow was a crucial step before releasing it towards the target.
